intro: Aureolaria tenuifolia var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial with slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
